name: DoubleTree by Hilton Albuquerque

reviews.text: The long-complained-about renovations are done, or at least are almost done. I did hear some minor noise during my stay but the lobby and my guest floor (four) were both finished and looked very nice.
reviews.title: Renovations are finished and hotel is very nice

likes.liked: — Comfortable rooms, easy access to freeways

reviews.text: My verdict on this hotel is simple: if you don't pay a lot, you'll be thrilled. If you pay $100+, you may be a little less impressed. I used a bidding site and thus give the Doubletree an "excellent" rating as I didn't pay the full rate. If I did, I may not overlook some of the minor flaws.
reviews.title: The hotel from Bizarro World--Stay at the Hyatt instead

reviews.text: Keep in mind that this is an older hotel so, even after a renovation, isn't going to look like a "W" Hotel. I think that's the design concept for the lobby ...check-in stations rather than a front desk, computer terminals for guest internet surfing, blue/red/green/purple light panels changing color, etc. It really doesn't work very well, in my opinion, but upon seeing the awful Southwestern theme of the lobby years ago, it's a big improvement.
reviews.title: Unimpressive

likes.disliked: — Loud construction noise, it was incessant

reviews.text: Room is typical of Hilton/Doubletree properties. White comforter/duvet that every chain is using, comfortable desk, nice beds, etc. No flat screen TVs yet and WiFi is dependable and free, a big plus.
reviews.title: Nice updates

reviews.text: You have to pay $10 for parking, which is a little annoying since the lot is rarely staffed. You can also find ample street parking (meters) if you're gonna be out early the next day. I had to do this my last night as the hotel lot was full and it was no problem. Probably should have tried street parking all 3 nights. The area of downtown surrounding the hotel is very quiet at night. If you don't have a car, you'll be walking a few blocks to Central Ave or eating room service (which was good!).
reviews.title: Good Mid-Grade Stop for Downtown

likes.liked: — New furniture, carpet and the FOOD!
likes.disliked: — Expensive internet, No Hot-Tub, Loud A/C

reviews.text: We recently returned from an extended weekend in New Mexico & stayed at this property. We have enjoyed our stays the Doubletree in Austin & San Antonio so decided to give it a shot. Well worth it. The staff went above and beyond on several occasions to help get shopping bags, assist with luggage etc. They even helped get our roof rack back on our vehicle! We ate breakfast at the restaurant almost every day and the food and service were equally impressive. We plan to head back next month to visit family and we will definitely be staying here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful Family Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anniversary night to remember! Wife and I took a break from the kiddos to celebrate our 13th wedding aniversary. Even though we're local, we wanted to go out on the town and really live it up! The Albuquerque Doubletree is convientently located downtown where we had a great night of dinner and dancing and later had a very relaxing "sleep in." The room had a fresh feeling and pillows were "comfy." The front staff were friendly and offered many good suggestions on where to go downtown. We plan to do this again...Maybe Valentienes 2012!
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel as part of our second leg trip between New Mexico and Arizona. The hotel is well located in downtown Albuquerque next to the convention center and within a few blocks of the down town bus terminal and Rail Runner station.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location, but the front desk staff need more training!

reviews.text: We were given a spacious room on the 9th floor with two double beds and stayed there mid week over two nights. The room was clean and the beds very comfortable. However, we had to pay extra for a refrigerator, as the rooms did not have them in the economy range. The hotel charged us $10/night . Each floor had vending machines and we were right opposite one on our floor. The hotel also has free wi fi both in the rooms and down in the main lobby.
reviews.title: not up to Doubletree standards

reviews.text: The staff were friendly but not very knowledgeable about all the tourist sites. We were told for example, that Sandia Peak (about 20 miles away..and a fabulous cable car experience up a mountain of 10.000+ feet) had taxi service outside its entrance. This was wrong and nearly got us stranded. In Albuquerque, unlike most other cities, you can not hail a cab. You have to order in advance. Fortunately, we were warned by the taxi driver and ordered one prior to our return trip to the hotel. This misinformation greatly disappointed us. I also pointed it out to the staff member concerned. That staff member did not acknowledge her mistake. Another member of the front desk did not know the bus routes, or how to get to the old part of the city.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A glance at the map suggested that the Doubletree would suit our needs during a vacation stay in Albuquerque. The property does appear to be well-situated for business and convention center travelers and we were able to get to Nob Bill, Old Town and the airport with ease. The staff were friendly, the hotel was clean and the service was good. The parking is pricey and the overall decor is somewhat dated. I do not recommend this hotel if rest and sleep are an important part of your travel needs. We were greeted at 300am on our first night by an argument somewhere on our floor (not the hotel's fault) and a police intervention. The doors are paper thin and you will hear every breath, footstep and door closing on your floor! That is, if your a/c unit doesn't drown out all other noise. We were usually awakened 6-7 times a night (on a cool night) by the a/c unit's explosive fan noise. Opening a window was not an option, so next time we will choose other lodging.Keep looking!
reviews.title: A mistake not to be repeated!

reviews.text: Fantastic Location that is adjacent to the convention center and walkable to Central Avenue and Albuquerque's night life. Hotel was very accommodating and clean. The property is modern and has a lot of natural light. The pricing was great and the views of the mountains are spectacular! Make sure to request a room with a view to the north. The breakfast buffet was okay and the hotel bar closed too early but other than that, great stay!
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: You pay for parking.
reviews.title: Disappoints a little

reviews.text: The bed is comfortable.
reviews.title: Not much gotten right

reviews.text: The rooms are overall nice.
reviews.title: Nice Place for Conference

reviews.text: Nice room, but you have to pay to park and dinner at the hotel was below average and made me sick. The walls are extremely thin, so if you are a light sleeper this is not the place for you! For the money, I would pick another property in the area.
reviews.title: Below average for the money

reviews.text: The good the bad, the bad and the ugly.
reviews.title: Night from Hell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel shuttle driver was excellent and very helpful.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: Check in was seamless, we were off to a great start until we stepped into the elevator and notice how dirty the carpet was inside and so was the carpet in the hallway leading to our room.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: Room was generally clean so we thought that our stay would be ok afterall.
reviews.title: Nice Rooms - Terrible Common Area's

reviews.text: The Double Tree was our home for the week. We stayed as part of a conference and I studied the reviews on this site carefully before choosing Double Tree over Hyatt. In the end, we are pleased with our choice. The renovations are over as stated, but the hotel is rather plain for a downtown hotel. We last stayed at a Double Tree in Philadelphia and that was an amazing hotel. This is given a rating of above average.
reviews.title: Good Choice for Conference in Albuquerque

reviews.text: There is a courtesy shuttle from the airport, which we were unaware of and it saved us money. We enjoyed our free cookie upon registering. We arrived at the hotel around 1:30 pm and our room wasn’t ready so we enjoyed their buffet lunch for $11.95 including soup, salad, and a pasta buffet. Also included were drinks and chocolate cake. Our north facing room was ready soon after we ate and we checked into a 13th floor king size non-smoking room which was clean. We saw no problems with the room at all. The bathroom was appropriate, the towels were large and soft enough, and our picture window gave us a great view of the mountains to the east and the hot air balloons to the west. We left our curtains open the entire time. Earlier reviews mentioned a loud AC unit which was true when set to turn on and off. After 2 nights of tossing and turning, we set the thermostat to fan and the unit was on continuously and was perfect. We did not hear noise from other rooms.
reviews.title: Stop! Read this first!

likes.disliked: — Nothing to like, it was a horrible experience

reviews.text: Overall, we found everyone in the hotel accommodating. This was just a boring hotel in a boring downtown. We did not have a car and there really was not anywhere safe to walk. We did visit the Hyatt, which had a little more going on, but their stores closed early. The bar at Double Tree was simple and not always staffed. Internet connection was free and we had uneven access. The convention center had great internet service and we were able to access the center through an underground walkway which was convenient.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but I will look elsewhere next time I'm in ABQ
Decent
reviews.text: Taxis were available to take us around but their fees were high. Bus fares were lower but were not safe. We met up with some friends to take us to the Sandia Tramway on beautiful afternoon and the nearby casinos had courtesy shuttle service. We had lots of fun at the Sandia Casino.
This is our experience. We will fill out some restaurant reviews. If you have any questions, please contact me.
reviews.title: Nice stay

likes.liked: — Location to Convention Center and Downtown

reviews.text: I chose this hotel as I am a Hilton Honors member, it's close to Old Town and because I could use my points. I am glad not to have paid the going rate. The lobby and public areas were nice/modern but upstairs and the room were not well maintained nor well cleaned, and the staff seemed indifferent. Though, the host in the restaurant on the morning of July 31 was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Okay for one night. A bit of a disappointment for Hilton.

reviews.text: This was a very nice hotel and conveniently located at the heart of downtown Albuquerque. My fiance and I were especially pleased with the customer service upon check in and with the bartender at the Ice Lounge as well. The food in the hotel was equally satisfying, but if that is not enough for one's taste there are many flavorful restaurants within walking distance. We've been here a few times and have always been extremely happy with the cleanliness, customer service, and the accommodations of the hotel. When visiting Albuquerque the Doubletree has become our first choice! Keep up the good work!
reviews.title: My number one choice!

reviews.text: We attended our friends wedding this past weekend and I had to share the exceptional service we all received by everyone we encountered at the Doubletree! Great Job everyone! We will defiantly be back for the yummy cookies too!
reviews.title: Best event ever!

reviews.text: My stay at at the Doubletree Hilton was on 13Aug. My cousin was having his wedding reception at the Doubletree so many of us decided to stay the night. I usually stay at Marriott's or Sheraton properties so I was looking forward to a Doubletree Hilton experience. I checked in about 2p, one staff member was handling the growing line of new guests. I think one staff member could have handled it except for the problem guest who was holding up the line. Once I was checked in I was given two of the Doubletree cookies they are known for and off to the 14th floor I went. The room was big, two beds, south facing view, very clean. I did notice that there are no safes in the room which was a problem for me since I had my passport in my bags. Since we were three in the room I phoned for extra towels, they were delivered about 15 minutes later. The bathroom had the basic amenities like soap, shampoo, conditioner. The TV remote was a bit cumbersome, it appeared that I had to pay to listen to any music. There is a self check out option which I always like.
reviews.title: Nice room but the property lacked amenities

reviews.text: I had looked at staying at this property several months prior when the room rates were about $125 a night. I decided to wait and see if they dropped which they did to about $85.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.text: I read (of course) the reviews here prior to booking. I will first have to agree that this is one of your 2 best options for a Convention Center stay. The Hyatt and Doubletree are on opposite blocks from the Center, and a very quick walk. This was one of the most important factors for me in booking, and the fact the Hyatt was booked and the Doubletree gave me HHonors points sealed the deal.
reviews.title: Decent Stay at the Doubletree

likes.disliked: — Felt it wasn't quite up to the brands quality

reviews.text: My 13th floor room had a great view of the Mountains and was spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable and had a plethora of pillows (plethora of pinata's?). The showerhead was a little low for my 6'3 head, but that is my only bathroom complaint.....it could be used as an handicap room.
reviews.title: More for conventions, not business stays

likes.disliked: — Lack of business amenities and very noisy--difficult to sleep

reviews.text: There was some wireless access to the Internet that I was not told about at the front desk, nor could find any documentation regarding it in the room guide. It was average at best and I decided my Sprint EVDO card was faster.
reviews.title: Best Convention Stay

reviews.text: The walls seemed rather thin, and I tried to keep the AC cranking to drown out any other noise and to keep my potential snoring as quiet for other guests. When the AC went off you coulud hear stuff through the wall, but it wasn't bad enough that I needed to call anyone.
reviews.title: Needs Work
Impressed (Twice).
reviews.text: Nice breakfast area and a large lobby, however the breakfast options were a little poor based on other Hilton Property breakfasts.

I stayed at the Double Tree ABQ for three nights last week for work. Staff was very friendly and made me feel at home during my stay. The hotel itself wasn't the greatest. When I checked in they had ran out of non-smoking rooms and I had to stay in a smoking. The air condition unit was literally hanging off the wall and had to call maintenance to fix it. My curtains would not shut so it was hard to sleep. Room service never got my order right (however was very quick). And the room service button to order did not work (just had a busy tone so had to call the front desk to transfer me everytime). Parking was $10/a day and very limited. One of the mornings I could not get out of the parking lot because someone had blocked the only enterance. Overall the stay was okay. My company paid $120/a night and personally think they could have gotten better for their money.
reviews.title: Average hotel, could do better in ABQ for the price

likes.disliked: — parking situation, ran out of non-smoking rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found ourselves in Albuquerque unexpectedly and ended up at the Doubletree. We were given an excellent rate: $79 per night plus taxes, etc. This is a huge hotel, about 16 floors high and is clean, attractive, modern, and well-maintained. I've never had a more comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Classy hotel at a great price

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is quite convenient if you have a car, as it is not far from Old Town, museums, and good restaurants. All of the employees were very courteous, helpful, and welcoming. We would definitely stay here again. I might add that Albuquerque is quite pleasant in August, as it is at an altitude of 5000 feet. It gets pretty warm in the afternoons, but it's very dry heat and cools down nicely at night. Mornings are perfect.
reviews.title: Quite average

likes.liked: — Free internet and AC you can control

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for ten nights in August 2008. The hotel is not horrible but its also not a luxury hotel.
reviews.title: This place is a MINUS 10

reviews.text: The staff at the front desk could use some lessons in efficiency. It took me three trips to various rooms to find a room that was not occupied or had not been cleaned. The staff was young and they did not seem like they had been through many lessons in customer service.
reviews.title: Good for a comfortable night, but not terribly exciting

likes.disliked: — Spotty wifi, could hear TV from next room

description: Modern surroundings, warm hospitality and a freshly baked chocolate chip cookie await your arrival at the DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Albuquerque. Located downtown, the hotel is conveniently connected by underground concourse to the Albuquerque Convention Center, close to the Civic Plaza and the historic Old Town. Albuquerque International Sunport Airport is just five miles from the hotel. Surrounded by trees, and with stunning views of the Sandia Mountains, this Albuquerque hotel offers a unique, relaxing setting in the heart of the city.Make yourself at home in a guest room decorated in soothing tones, and with complimentary high-speed internet access and amenities for work and relaxation. Choose a suite for a separate living area, upgraded amenities package, dining table and sofa bed. Our downtown Albuquerque hotel has flexible event space for up to 300 guests and a fully equipped business center. Print from your room and pick it up at the business center with our useful remote printing service.Catch up with work while sipping your favorite Starbucks coffee at Onyx Café, taking advantage of the complimentary WiFi in all public areas, or gather with friends and colleagues at ICE Lounge, enjoying the contemporary decor and range of refreshing ice cold drinks. Sample New Mexican and coastal Californian cuisine at La Oja Restaurant at breakfast, lunch and dinner. Relax poolside, admiring the mountain views and fresh air, or work out at the fitness center featuring the latest in cardiovascular and strength equipment.
